author: dlr
msg: Corrected problem with JavaDoc pointed out by Bruce Altner
<baltner at hq.nasa.gov>:
A while back I referred to a problem I was having with inconsistent
behavior of the $page.setHttpEquiv() method when trying to redirect to
a different template. The javadocs (for the TemplatePageAttributes
class) suggest this syntax:
setHttpEquiv("refresh", "5; http://localhost/nextpage.html")
whereas to get it to work I needed to write:
setHttpEquiv("refresh", "5; URL=http://localhost/nextpage.html")
Now I can scrap the javascript!

author: dlr
msg: Backported changes by myself and Jason van Zyl.  Prompted by patch

tried to fix a problem which I'd already fixed in the stand-alone
repo.

author: mpoeschl
msg: Apart from fixing a few typos in the previous version, the
patch includes details of how to overcome the problem
where related objects are not saved when user.save() is
invoked.  To do this, I have included a patch within the
patch - I have not submitted the patch to Object.vm
described within as it seems a bit like a hack to me.
patch by
Scott Eade <seade@backstagetech.com.au>
